messages.title: WHO IS KEITH HILL?
messages.content: The Council is describing Keith Hill as the 'independent' chair of its housing commission. In reality, Keith Hill is an ex Labour MP and was Tony Blair's housing minister between 2003 and 2005.

messages.title: Council leaseholders have no say in the future of council housing
messages.content: You probably got a letter last week from Cllr Lisa Homan, the Council's Cabinet Member for Housing, about Labour's position on the future of LBHF council housing.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Charlie Dewhirst warns against higher service charges, loss of control over council housing management, threat of property being sold to social landlord or private company, and mergers and takeovers leading to loss of local accountability.

housing.content: Concerns about losing decision-making autonomy on housing, increased charges, and risks to property ownership and local management.

contactInformation.address: Hammersmith Conservatives, 4 Greyhound Road, London W6 8NX

images.caption: Image of Charlie Dewhirst with text indicating his political affiliation to the Conservative party and his candidacy for Hammersmith & Shepherds Bush.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet includes a narrative that positions Charlie Dewhirst against council housing changes proposed by rival political figures and highlights the tactical decision-making by Labour council regarding housing in Hammersmith.
